Package au.edu.anu.twuifx.widgets.helpers

Class DelayTask

java.lang.Object
au.edu.anu.twuifx.widgets.helpers.DelayTask
public class DelayTask extends Object
Static class to prevent animation tasks flickering. This can occur when many tasks are rapidly submitted to Platform.runLater(). 'gap'.
Author:
Ian Davies 24 Apr 2022

    static long
    submit​(long gap, long head, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> task)
    To prevent flicker, tasks are placed in a Timeline to be run at some time in the future ('head') at a rate no greater than the value of 'gap'.

  • Method Details

    • submit

      public static long submit​(long gap, long head, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> task)
      To prevent flicker, tasks are placed in a Timeline to be run at some time in the future ('head') at a rate no greater than the value of 'gap'.

      If the generation of tasks is faster than 'gap', animations will lag behind their computation, sometimes very noticeably. Typically, 'gap' need be no greater than 1 ms.

      NOTE: To prevent concurrent modification exceptions, this method must only be called from the application thread.

      Parameters:
      gap - time in ms to advance the time front. Must be > 0
      head - the current value of the time front
      task - submitted task to run at that time.
      Returns:
      updated value of time front.
